item.title: Report E-2025020130
item.description:
Report E-2025020130

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-13T06:18:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-07
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On February 7, 2025, one (1) 5-gallon pail of paint was damaged and released approximately one (1) gallon to the trailer and dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the site. The crew overpacked the damaged pail in one (1) 55-gallon drum. TLE used absorbents and hand tools to collect all material in the same one (1) 55-gallon drum.

item.title: Report X-2025020367
item.description:
Report X-2025020367

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-13T06:18:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-06
  • City: DAYTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ABF Freight
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Cassie Osterfeld, 064 Operations Supervisor, contacted Safety regarding a potential Hazardous spill. Cassie Osterfeld advised the spill is actively leaking from the trailer striking the yard. Cassie Osterfeld advised after looking at the manifest 064 believes it's leaking from a 55 gallon drum with a white appearance. Per CURA cause of damage is an appeared forklift strike prior to arriving at the 064 SC.

item.title: Report I-2025010024
item.description:
Report I-2025010024

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-13T06:18:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-26
  • City: MASSILLON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: PVS TRANSPORTATION, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: PVS driver was offloading Ferric with no view of the tank. Site representative was watching tank levels. As driver was nearing end of the load, site representative asked him to shut off tank, however tank was already over filling. Site representative indicated they had a rope and ball gauge and it was sticking and not functioning properly. No injuries/exposure.

item.title: Report E-2025020093
item.description:
Report E-2025020093

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-10T06:19:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-03
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: On February 3, 2025, one (1) 330-gallon tote of phosphoric acid was punctured and released approximately 330-gallons of product to the asphalt pavement and nearby storm drain. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted site. TLE personnel noted that the product released into a storm drain onsite and began utilizing a vacuum trailer to remove the liquids at each storm drain between the terminal building and the retention pond. All acid impacted liquids were collected and containerized into three (3) 330-gallon totes and one (1) 275-gallon tote and staged onsite for further management.

item.title: Report E-2025020052
item.description:
Report E-2025020052

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-08T03:31:42+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-04
  • City: PARMA
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 8500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO-Logistics contacted ERTS regarding damaged plastic bags of hazardous product, ABF-004. A contractor dispatched and observed an estimated 1lb release from two bags onto the wooden trailer floor in a 4’ x 4’ area and the concrete dock floor in a 2’x2’ area as a result of improper loading. The contractor cleaned-up the release using a HEPA vac. Two 55-gallon DF’s containing the damaged bags of product, impacted PPE, and impacted plastic were generated for waste disposal. XPO will manage all waste created from the spill response. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil were involved in this incident.
